Michael Chen
Chen Construction LLC

test_emails.subject: Q4 Supplier Partnership Proposal
test_emails.body:
Dear Joe,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to discuss the possibility of expanding our supplier partnership for Q4 2024 and beyond.

Your building supply business has been experiencing consistent growth over the past 18 months, and we've noticed your increasing order volumes across multiple product categories. Our company has identified you as a strategic partner for our regional expansion.

We are looking to establish preferred vendor relationships with approximately 15-20 building supply companies across the tri-state area. The program would include priority access to inventory, preferential pricing, and dedicated account management.

From a financial perspective, we're offering volume discounts of 15-20% on orders over $50,000, though specific terms are subject to contract negotiation. We would need to finalize agreements by the end of September to ensure Q4 pricing is locked in.

Some specific benefits we can provide include:
- Guaranteed inventory allocation during supply shortages
- Extended payment terms (Net 60 instead of Net 30)
- Free delivery on orders over $5,000
- Priority customer service and technical support

Could you provide feedback on this proposal and let me know if you'd be interested in moving forward? We would also appreciate references from other suppliers you work with to understand your current vendor relationships.

Our timeline is somewhat tight - we'd like to have initial agreements in place by the end of this month so we can present the full partnership roster to our executive team in early September.

Please let me know if you need any additional information or would like to schedule a call to discuss this further.

Best regards,
Rebecca Foster
Regional Sales Manager
National Building Supplies Inc.
